greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of anti-run permutations of the prime indices of Mersenne numbers A000225(n) = 2^n - 1.
comment: An anti-run is a sequence with no adjacent equal parts.
A prime index of n is a number m such that prime(m) divides n. The multiset of prime indices of n is row n of A112798.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
xref: The version for factorial numbers is A335407.
Permutations of prime indices are A008480.
Separable partitions are ranked by A335433.
Inseparable partitions are ranked by A335448.
Anti-run permutations of prime indices are A335452.
Strict permutations of prime indices are A335489.
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Jul 02 2020
ext: Terms a(51) and beyond from _Andrew Howroyd_, Feb 03 2021
